title: How to Update Viber on Android or iOS

steps.title: Open the Google Play Store on your Android phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open the Google Play Store on your Android phone or tablet. Look for a colorful play triangle on your home screen or in the app drawer.

steps.title: Tap the 3 horizontal lines ☰.
steps.content: Tap the 3 horizontal lines ☰ . This is in the top left corner.

steps.title: Tap My apps & games.
steps.content: Tap My apps & games . This is the option at the top.

steps.title: Scroll through the list of "Updates pending" and look for Viber.
steps.content: Scroll through the list of "Updates pending" and look for Viber. It has a purple icon with a white phone. If you do not see Viber in this list, check the Installed tab. It may already be updated to the latest version. If you believe there is a more recent update but the app store does not have it, it may not be available in your region on the Google Play Store. Try method 3 instead.

steps.title: Tap Update next to Viber.
steps.content: Tap Update next to Viber. This will be the button to the right. The app will start updating.

steps.title: Open the App Store on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open the App Store on your iPhone or iPad. Look for a blue icon with a white "A" on your home screen.

steps.title: Tap on Updates.
steps.content: Tap on Updates. This is in the bottom right.

steps.title: Scroll through the list of "Updates Pending" and look for Viber.
steps.content: Scroll through the list of "Updates Pending" and look for Viber. It has a purple icon with a white phone. If you do not see Viber in this list, it may already be updated to the latest version.

steps.title: Tap Update next to Viber.
steps.content: Tap Update next to Viber. This will be the button to the right. The app will start updating.

steps.title: Enable APK installations on your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Enable APK installations on your phone or tablet. Do the following: Go to Settings on your Android Tap Apps and notifications (or Biometrics and security on a Samsung Galaxy). Tap Install unknown apps . Tap on your preferred browser, such as Chrome or Firefox . Tap the switch to turn it on. This method is best if you cannot find a recent update on the Google Play Store in your region. Take caution when using APKs. If downloaded from an untrusted source, they can contain malware.

steps.title: Find your hardware information.
steps.content: Find your hardware information. You need to know the architecture. If you do not know it, do the following: Open the Google Play Store on your Android phone or tablet. Search for "Droid Hardware Info" by InkWired [1] X Research source . Tap Install . Launch Droid Info. Either allow or deny the requested permissions—you don't need these granted in order to view device info. Tap the System tab at the top. Note down the "Instruction Sets" info in the middle of the "Processor" section.

steps.title: Open a browser on your Android phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open a browser on your Android phone or tablet. Use the same preferred browser app that you enabled in the previous step.

steps.title: Go to https://www.apkmirror.com/.
steps.content: Go to https://www.apkmirror.com/ . Tap the link on your Android phone or tablet, or type in the address. This is a trusted website used to download APK packages for Android apps.

steps.title: Search for Viber.
steps.content: Search for Viber. Tap on the search bar at the top and type in "viber".

steps.title: Tap on the desired APK.
steps.content: Tap on the desired APK. Use the most recently released version. Only use the Wear OS version for supported Google smartwatches.

steps.title: Tap See Available APKs.
steps.content: Tap See Available APKs . You can also scroll down to the "Download" section.

steps.title: Tap on the correct APK for your phone.
steps.content: Tap on the correct APK for your phone. Match the "Arch" (architecture) to the "Instructions Sets" noted down from the Hardware Info app.

steps.title: Tap Download APK once the button is purple.
steps.content: Tap Download APK once the button is purple. It will be grayed out until it is ready to tap.

steps.title: Tap on the download once downloaded.
steps.content: Tap on the download once downloaded. This will appear in the browser app once done. If you cannot find it, search for the APK file in the downloads folder of your Files app. Just make sure to allow the Files app to install unknown apps as shown in Step 1. The new update will install automatically.
